title: Authorizes Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal to apply to the assessor of the town of Islip for a real property tax exemption
summary: Authorizes Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal to apply to the assessor of the town of Islip for a real property tax exemption commencing on the date of conveyance of a certain parcel to such organization.

       AN ACT to authorize Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal to file  an  application
         for a real property tax exemption

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary,
    2  the assessor of the town of Islip is hereby authorized  to  accept  from
    3  Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal an application for exemption from real prop-
    4  erty  taxes  pursuant  to section 420-a of the real property tax law for
    5  the 2001-2002 assessment roll, as to which March 1, 2001 was the taxable
    6  status date, with respect to the real property taxes for such assessment
    7  roll, for the parcel conveyed to such organization on  August  7,  2001,
    8  with  such  parcel  being  located  in  the town of Islip at 2 MacArthur
    9  Avenue, Brentwood, otherwise known as: district  0500,  section  136.00,
   10  block 01.00, lot 17.1. If accepted, the application shall be reviewed as
   11  if it had been received on or before the taxable status date established
   12  for such roll.
   13    If  satisfied  that  such  organization would otherwise be entitled to
   14  such exemption  if  such  organization  had  filed  an  application  for
   15  exemption  by  the  appropriate taxable status date, the assessor of the
   16  town of Islip, upon approval by the town board of such town,  may  grant
   17  exemption  from  all taxation beginning on the date of the conveyance of
   18  such parcel to such organization on the effective date of this  act  and
   19  cancel  taxes,  fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and make
   20  appropriate correction of the subject roll.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2636

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to authorize Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal to file an application for a
real property tax exemption

PURPOSE:
To authorize the town of Islip to grant a real property tax exemption
to Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal for payment of real property taxes in
connection with the 2001-2002 assessment roll.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would authorize the assessor of the town of Islip to accept
an application for exemption from real property taxes pursuant to
Section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law for the 2001-2002
assessment roll. If satisfied that Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal would
otherwise have been entitled to said exemption, the assessor, upon
approval of the town board, is authorized to grant the exemption and
cancel all remaining unpaid taxes, interest, related fines and
penalties.

JUSTIFICATION:
Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal Church did not apply for a real property
tax exemption pursuant to section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law
for the 2001-2002 assessment roll in connection with the pastoral
parsonage it owns in the Town of Islip. Due to this failure, taxes
and penalties of $15,978.35 are now due from the Church and the
parcel is threatened by tax lien foreclosure. This bill would allow
the town of Islip to accept a retroactive application from Iglesia de
Dios Pentecostal and waive the aforementioned taxes and penalties now
due. Iglesia de Dios Pentecostal membership is made up of a small
group of individuals and families. It would be a severe hardship for
these members to raise the money needed to pay the back taxes for the
property.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10: S.1284/A.4130

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the state. The Town of Islip would waive $15,978.35 in taxes
and penalty upon approval by the town board.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
